I LOVE the Don‚Äôt Starve series. But Shipwrecked, is a disappointment. Only because there are SO MANY BUGS!  I‚Äôve made it all the way to a sixth world and couldn‚Äôt continue because one of the transport ‚ÄúThings‚Äù was in a pond...so no way to get to it. Among so many other glitches, this one was the last straw. 
I normally wouldn‚Äôt care so much but this game carries a high cost for an App game, so I feel it should....work!  Ultimately, I‚Äôm sad...I love this game but working so hard to survive and then die as a result from a glitch, is extremely frustrating!  I hope the people at Kei are working to alleviate this.

title.label: I like this better than the original.

content.label:
- I actually played this first rather than the original Dont Starve and I find this one more enjoyable.

- I like the mechanics of this game and it is harder which is nice.  The original is way too easy for me.

- I love the music and almost everything about this game. üòÄ

+ Things I would like: I kind of wish there was more variety in the islands and I would like it if Webber and Wigfrid were here in this game.  I know this is supposed to be hard but I feel like it‚Äôs too hard sometimes to get food, manure, and meat especially.  

- I would honesty rather have a difficult game rather than an easy one.  (Not too hard or too easy.) 

Other than that this game is amazing Klei. üòÉüòÄ üå¥

title.label: I Love DST, but shipwrecked, not so much

content.label:
Don‚Äôt Starve is a great game, and even this DLC is virtually the same as the computer or console versions. However, this DLC only offers one game play mode, when you die, game over, begin again. Considering how long it take to move from island to island I personally feel this penalties is too harsh and prevents me from getting into the game.  Don‚Äôt starve app has a no sweat mode, why not this one?

Also I‚Äôd appreciate being able to use my Bluetooth controller, I can on Don‚Äôt Starve, but not here.

When did you sneak in the Home Sea Home update?! I could swear I checked the update notes every time because I'm one of the weirdos who actually like the iOS interface a lot, and I've been really sad that I couldn't play Shipwrecked on iOS because the Home Sea Home content is so, so important.

So, yay! It's here at last!

(Although it looks like some minor things are still a bit buggy -- Walani's descriptions of most of the new content are "It's a...thing", which is afaik the default "oops, we forgot to put in a description of this" description -- I have not run into any real problems yet, although I just noticed this yesterday so I'm only a few hours in.)
